abstract: Anthony Tommasini looks back on Alan Gilbert's tenure at New York Philharmonic following news that he will step down in 2017; remarks that despite grumbling over his work, orchestra and its audience may regret his departure, given how much he has done to expand the Philharmonic's repertoire.
lead_paragraph: More than any of his predecessors since Leonard Bernstein, Mr. Gilbert has tried to expand the template for what a major American orchestra can be.

headline.main: Alan Gilbert’s Exit From the New York Philharmonic Sends Uncertain Signals
headline.print_headline: Losing a Director, and Possibly a Direction

snippet: More than any of his predecessors since Leonard Bernstein, Mr. Gilbert has tried to expand the template for what a major American orchestra can be.
